trans-unit.source: Represents the properties of the paging controls in a control that supports pagination.
This class cannot be inherited.

Controls that support pagination (such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> controls) can display a set of controls called *the pager* that allows the user to navigate the pages within the control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings> class is used by these controls to represent the properties of the pager.
In general, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings> object is stored in the `PagerSettings` property of the control.
You can customize the pager by setting the properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings> object.
The pager supports several different display modes.
To specify the mode in which to display the pager, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode%2A> property.
The following table describes the different modes.
Mode
Description
Previous-page and next-page buttons.
Previous-page, next-page, first-page, and last -page buttons.
Numbered link buttons to access pages directly.
Numbered-link, first-link, and last-link buttons.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPrevious>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPreviousFirstLast>, or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NumericFirstLast> value you can customize the text of the non-numeric buttons by setting the properties shown in the following table.
Property
Description
Text for the first-page button.
Text for the previous-page button.
Text for the next-page button.
Text for the last-page button.
As an alternative, you can also display images for the non-numeric buttons by setting the properties as shown in the following table.
Property
Description
The URL to an image to display for the first-page button.
The URL to an image to display for the previous-page button.
The URL to an image to display for the next-page button.
The URL to an image to display for the last-page button.
When an image property is set, the corresponding text property acts as the alternate text for the image.

For example, when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageImageUrl%2A> property is set, the text that is specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageText%2A> property is displayed as the alternate text for the image.
On browsers that support ToolTips, this text is also displayed as a ToolTip for the corresponding button.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.Numeric> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NumericFirstLast> value, you can specify the number of page buttons to display in the pager by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PageButtonCount%2A> property.
The pager can be displayed at the top, the bottom, or both the top and bottom of a control.
To specify the position of the pager, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Position%2A> property.
To show or hide the pager, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Visible%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings"></xref> class.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.%23ctor%2A> constructor to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings> class.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.%23ctor%2A> constructor generally is used by control developers when providing paging support in a custom control.
Gets or sets the URL to an image to display for the first-page button.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPreviousFirstLast> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NumericFirstLast> value, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageImageUrl%2A> property to specify the URL to an image to display for the first-page button.

As an alternative, you can display text for the first-page button by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageText%2A> property instead of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageImageUrl%2A> property.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageImageUrl%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageText%2A> properties are both set, the image is displayed with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageText%2A> property acting as the alternate text for the image.
On browsers that support ToolTips, this text is also displayed as a ToolTip for the corresponding button.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
The URL to an image to display for the first-page button.
The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageImageUrl"></xref> is not set.
Gets or sets the text to display for the first-page button.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPreviousFirstLast> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NumericFirstLast> value, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageText%2A> property to specify the text to display for the first-page button.

As an alternative, you can display an image for the first-page button by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageImageUrl%2A> property instead of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageText%2A> property.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageImageUrl%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageText%2A> properties are both set, the image is displayed with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageText%2A> property acting as the alternate text for the image.
On browsers that support ToolTips, this text is also displayed as a ToolTip for the corresponding button.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
The text to display for the first-page button.
The default is "<<", which renders as "<<".
Gets or sets the URL to an image to display for the last-page button.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPreviousFirstLast> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NumericFirstLast> value, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.LastPageImageUrl%2A> property to specify the URL to an image to display for the last-page button.

As an alternative, you can simply display text for the last-page button by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.LastPageText%2A> property instead of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.LastPageImageUrl%2A> property.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.LastPageImageUrl%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.LastPageText%2A> properties are both set, the image is displayed with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.LastPageText%2A> property acting as the alternate text for the image.
On browsers that support ToolTips, this text is also displayed as a ToolTip for the corresponding button.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
The URL to an image to display for the last-page button.
The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.LastPageImageUrl"></xref> is not set.
Gets or sets the text to display for the last-page button.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPreviousFirstLast> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NumericFirstLast> value, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.LastPageText%2A> property to specify the text to display for the last-page button.

As an alternative, you can display an image for the last-page button by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.LastPageImageUrl%2A> property instead of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.LastPageText%2A> property.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.LastPageImageUrl%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.LastPageText%2A> properties are both set, the image is displayed with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.LastPageText%2A> property acting as the alternate text for the image.
On browsers that support ToolTips, this text is also displayed as a ToolTip for the corresponding button.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
The text to display for the last-page button.
The default is ">>", which renders as ">>".
Gets or sets the mode in which to display the pager controls in a control that supports pagination.
Controls that support pagination provide multiple modes in which to display the paging controls.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode%2A> property to specify the mode.
The following table describes the different modes for pagination controls.
Mode
Description
Previous-page and next-page buttons.
Previous-page, next-page, first-page, and last-page buttons.
Numbered link buttons to access pages directly.
Numbered and first-link and last-link buttons.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPrevious>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPreviousFirstLast>, or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NumericFirstLast> value, you can specify custom text for the non-numeric buttons by setting the properties shown in the following table.
Property
Description
Text for the first-page button.
Text for the previous-page button.
Text for the next-page button.
Text for the last-page button.
As an alternative, you can also display images for the non-numeric buttons by setting the properties shown in the following table.
Property
Description
The URL to an image to display for the first-page button.
The URL to an image to display for the previous-page button.
The URL to an image to display for the next-page button.
The URL to an image to display for the last-page button.
When an image property is set, the corresponding text property acts as the alternate text for the image.

For example, when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageImageUrl%2A> property is set, the text that is specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.FirstPageText%2A> property is displayed as the alternate text for the image.
On browsers that support ToolTips, this text is also displayed as a ToolTip for the corresponding button.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons"></xref> values.
The default is `PagerButtons.Numeric`.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode"></xref> is set to a value that is not one of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons"></xref> values.
Gets or sets the URL to an image to display for the next-page button.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NumericFirstLast> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPrevious> value, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageImageUrl%2A> property to specify the URL to an image to display for the next-page button.

As an alternative, you can simply display text for the next-page button by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageText%2A> property instead of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageImageUrl%2A> property.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageImageUrl%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageText%2A> properties are both set, the image is displayed with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageText%2A> property acting as the alternate text for the image.
On browsers that support ToolTips, this text is also displayed as a ToolTip for the corresponding button.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
The URL to an image to display for the next-page button.
The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageImageUrl"></xref> is not set.
Gets or sets the text to display for the next-page button.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NumericFirstLast> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPrevious> value, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageText%2A> property to specify the text to display for the next-page button.

As an alternative, you can display an image for the next-page button by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageImageUrl%2A> property instead of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageText%2A> property.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageImageUrl%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageText%2A> properties are both set, the image is displayed with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.NextPageText%2A> property acting as the alternate text for the image.
On browsers that support ToolTips, this text is also displayed as a ToolTip for the corresponding button.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
The text to display for the next-page button.
The default is ">", which renders as ">".

Gets or sets the number of page buttons to display in the pager when the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode"></xref> property is set to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.Numeric"></xref> or <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NumericFirstLast"></xref> value.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.Numeric> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NumericFirstLast> value, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PageButtonCount%2A> property to specify the number of page buttons to display in the pager.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
The number of page buttons to display in the pager.
The default is 10.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PageButtonCount"></xref> is set to a value that is less than 1.
Gets or sets a value that specifies the location where the pager is displayed.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Position%2A> property to specify the location at which to display the pager.
The following table describes the different positions.
Position
Location
The bottom of the control.
The top of the control.
At both the top and bottom of the control.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerPosition"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerPosition.Bottom"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Position"></xref> is set to a value that is not one of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerPosition"></xref> values.
Gets or sets the URL to an image to display for the previous-page button.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPreviousFirstLast> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPrevious> value, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PreviousPageImageUrl%2A> property to specify the URL to an image to display for the previous-page button.

As an alternative, you can display text for the previous-page button by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PreviousPageText%2A> property instead of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PreviousPageImageUrl%2A> property.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PreviousPageImageUrl%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PreviousPageText%2A> properties are both set, the image is displayed with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PreviousPageText%2A> property acting as the alternate text for the image.
On browsers that support ToolTips, this text is also displayed as a ToolTip for the corresponding button.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
The URL to an image to display for the previous-page button.
The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PreviousPageImageUrl"></xref> is not set.
Gets or sets the text to display for the previous page button.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Mode%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPreviousFirstLast> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerButtons.NextPrevious> value, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PreviousPageText%2A> property to specify the text to display for the previous-page button.

As an alternative, you can display an image for the previous-page button by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PreviousPageImageUrl%2A> property instead of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PreviousPageText%2A> property.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PreviousPageImageUrl%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PreviousPageText%2A> properties are both set, the image is displayed with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PreviousPageText%2A> property acting as the alternate text for the image.
On browsers that support ToolTips, this text is also displayed as a ToolTip for the corresponding button.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
The text to display for the previous page button.
The default is "<", which renders as "<".
Occurs when a property of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings"></xref> object changes values.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PropertyChanged> event is raised each time a property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings> object changes values.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.PropertyChanged> event commonly is used by data-bound controls that support pagination to rebind the data to the control when the pager settings change.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
Retrieves the string representation of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.ToString%2A> method is used to retrieve a string representation of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings> object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.ToString%2A> method has been overridden to always return an empty string.
An empty string ("").
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the paging controls are displayed in a control that supports pagination.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Visible%2A> property to specify whether the paging controls are displayed in a control that supports pagination.
To hide the paging controls, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.Visible%2A> property to `false`.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
`true` to display the pager; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the server control is tracking its view state changes.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings> instance is cast to the <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
`true` if the data source view is marked to save its state; otherwise, `false`.
Loads the previously saved view state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings"></xref> object.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23LoadViewState%2A> method to load the previously saved view state of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings> object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23LoadViewState%2A> method is private and cannot be called.
An object that represents the state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings"></xref>.
Saves the current view state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23SaveViewState%2A> method is a helper method that is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings> class to save the state of the object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23SaveViewState%2A> method is private and cannot be called.
An object that contains the saved state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings"></xref>.
Marks the starting point at which to begin tracking and saving view state changes to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23TrackViewState%2A> method is overridden to mark the starting point at which to begin tracking and saving changes to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings> object as part of the view state for the object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerSettings.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23TrackViewState%2A> method is private and cannot be called.
